Player 2.1 driver specification

Name:
  • epuck

Provides:
  • position2d
  • ir
  • camera
  • blinkenlight

Requires:
  • none

Implemented requests:
interface_position2d
  • PLAYER_POSITION2D_CMD_VEL
  • PLAYER_POSITION2D_CMD_CAR
  • PLAYER_POSITION2D_REQ_GET_GEOM
  • PLAYER_POSITION2D_REQ_SET_ODOM
  • PLAYER_POSITION2D_REQ_RESET_ODOM
  • PLAYER_POSITION2D_DATA_STATE
interface_ir :
  • PLAYER_IR_REQ_POSE
  • PLAYER_IR_DATA_RANGES
interface_camera :
  • PLAYER_CAMERA_DATA_STATE
blinkenlight
  • PLAYER_BLINKENLIGHT_CMD_POWER
Configuration file example:
 driver
 (
   name "epuck"
   plugin "libepuck"

   provides ["position2d:0"
             "ir:0"
             "camera:0"
             "ring_led0:::blinkenlight:0"
             "ring_led1:::blinkenlight:1"
             "ring_led2:::blinkenlight:2"
             "ring_led3:::blinkenlight:3"
             "ring_led4:::blinkenlight:4"
             "ring_led5:::blinkenlight:5"
             "ring_led6:::blinkenlight:6"
             "ring_led7:::blinkenlight:7"
             "front_led:::blinkenlight:8"
             "body_led:::blinkenlight:9"]

   port "/dev/rfcomm1"
 )

Each of the eigth ring LEDs, the front LED, and the body LED can be used independently, and the keys "ring_ledX" (where X is the number of ring LED), "front_led" and "body_led" must be placed in blinkenlight device addresses. Without them that LED won't be subscribed.
